comments:
- I had the GTK build running for a while then I installed the motif build and
ran it against the same workspace. 
- Then I opened my launch configs and edited the program args for my Runtime
Workbench config and didn't save.
- I clicked on New to create a new launch config
- I was prompted that I had unsaved changes, did I want to save?
- Yes
- NPE and didn't create new config

I'm not able to reproduce with similar steps. Can you?

I'll try with a fresh workspace, etc.

Note that I just hit the "close" button on the dialog (yes I left my machine on
last night :-) and I got a "Discard Changes?" dialog with the following message:

The configuration "Runtime Workbench (motif)" has unsaved changes that CANNOT be
saved because of the following error: Launch Configuration already exists with
this name 
Do you wish to discard changes?

Got it. Here are the exact steps:

- start eclipse GTK on fresh workspace
- go to Debug perspective
- create a new launch config for a runtime workbench
- in the "Program Args" add: "-ws gtk" <- my launch config had this because it
was old
- run the launch config
- shut down runtime workbench
- shut down eclipse
- start eclipse MOTIF on the same workspace
- go to Debug perspective
- try to run launch config
- won't work (because of the wrong WS)
- configure launch config
- change "-ws gtk" to "-ws motif"
- modify the title to read "New_configuration (motif)"
- don't save or apply yet
- hit "New"
- prompted for save
- yes save changes

Get the NPE and the problems as noted above.

The GTK-motif switch is unnecessary. Steps can be reduced to:
1 - select an existing launch config
2 - change it's name
3 - click new
4 - say yes to save changes

The action tries to get the current selection but receives null and "type" variable is set to null -> NPE. 
Not sure why the selection is being returned as null.

Selection was not being maintained properly in the LaunchConfigurationView. Changing the name of a 
config actually deletes the old config (the current selection) and creates a brand new one w/o resetting 
the selection.
Fixed in LaunchConfigurationView, reset the selection to the new one.
